definition[0]: to be in a position of authority at a time when important things are happening
example[0]: The government seemed to be presiding over large-scale unemployment.
definition[1]: to be the head of a company or organization
example[1]: Finch presided over the company for 30 years.
definition[2]: to be in charge of a meeting or activity
example[2]: The chairman will preside over an audience of architects and developers.
